intro: Heliophila grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered heliophyte, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Heliophila grandiflora is native to regions of Europe and parts of Asia, where it is often found in meadows and along stream banks. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
